Class dnx.jack.ActionBehavior 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----dnx.jack.Behavior
           |
           +----dnx.jack.ActionBehavior
public class ActionBehavior
extends Behavior
The ActionBehavior class is the base class for all Behaviors that exist only to respond to Events. Note that other Behaviors can respond to Events as well, but ActionBehaviors are things like URL-Link behaviors that do nothing more.
Author:
Patrick Schmitz

ActionBehavior()
Constructs a default ActionBehavior with name "Action".
ActionBehavior(String)
Constructs a default ActionBehavior with a name.

Returns the basic behavior class (i.e.
getDuration()
ActionBehaviors have no duration on the timeline, and should not affect the timeline duration.
update(TimeContext, Sequence)
As a convenience to subclasses, we provide a null update() method.

ActionBehavior 
  public ActionBehavior()
Constructs a default ActionBehavior with name "Action".
ActionBehavior 
  public ActionBehavior(String name)
Constructs a default ActionBehavior with a name.

getBehaviorClass 
  public final Class getBehaviorClass()
Returns the basic behavior class (i.e. the immediate subclass of Behavior). This is final, so that further subclasses don't try to handle this. Only immediate subclasses of Behavior should implement this.
Overrides:
getBehaviorClass in class Behavior
getDuration 
  public final int getDuration()
ActionBehaviors have no duration on the timeline, and should not affect the timeline duration. As such, getDuration is defined to return 0, and is defined as final to ensure this logic.
Returns:
0, to indicate that this has no duration.
Overrides:
getDuration in class Behavior
update 
  public boolean update(TimeContext tc,
                        Sequence seq)
As a convenience to subclasses, we provide a null update() method. If some ActionBehavior needs to update, it can override this. Note that by default, ActionBehaviors do not affect the state of the associated sequence at update time (but rather only when an event triggers the Action).
Parameters:
tc - the time context on the parent Sequence timeline.
seq - the Sequence upon which the Behavior acts.
Returns:
true if Behavior made any real change.
Overrides:
update in class Behavior
